name: Fellowship / Union of People (同人, Tóng Rén)

core_meaning.legge_1899_public_domain: Thung Zăn (or 'Union of men') appears here (as we find it) in the (remote districts of the) country, indicating progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to maintain the firm correctness of the superior man.
core_meaning.normalized_summary: True alliance. People unite around shared purpose, openly and without selfish agenda. This kind of fellowship is strong enough to take on major challenges and cross big thresholds — but only if integrity stays centered, not factional loyalty.

translations.text: The first NINE, undivided, (shows the representative of) the union of men just issuing from his gate. There will be no error.

lines.normalized_meaning: You begin by making yourself available and visible. Opening the gate to others — showing up honestly — is safe.

translations.text: The second SIX, divided, (shows the representative of) the union of men in relation with his kindred. There will be occasion for regret.

lines.normalized_meaning: If you only ally with ‘your own people,’ it degrades. Cliques, blood loyalty, in-groups: this limits the union and creates regret.

translations.text: The third NINE, undivided, (shows its subject) with his arms hidden in the thick grass, and at the top of a high mound. (But) for three years he makes no demonstration.
九三：伏戎于莽，升其高陵，三歲不興。

lines.normalized_meaning: Suspicion poisons unity. Hiding weapons, watching from high ground, waiting to strike — that posture freezes true cooperation for a long time.

translations.text: The fourth NINE, undivided, (shows its subject) mounted on the city wall; but he does not proceed to make the attack (he contemplates). There will be good fortune.

lines.normalized_meaning: You have position and leverage. Choosing not to attack is actually the win. Restraint preserves the possibility of alliance.

translations.text: In the fifth NINE, undivided, (the representative of) the union of men first wails and cries out, and then laughs. His great host conquers, and he (and the subject of the second line) meet together.
九五：同人，先號咷而後笑。大師克，相遇。

lines.normalized_meaning: Real fellowship is forged through shared struggle. After crisis and grief comes reunion, decisive success, and reconciliation between leaders/allies who were previously divided.

translations.text: The topmost NINE, undivided, (shows the representative of) the union of men in the suburbs. There will be no occasion for repentance.

lines.normalized_meaning: Mature alliance doesn’t depend on central authority. Fellowship extends outward, beyond walls and titles, and you don’t have to regret standing in that wider human bond.
